Entries.default: "Mighty winds sent us north, to the shores of Rauatai,"
"Forth to victory, Rauatai! Triumph o'er your foes."
"O mighty people, O Rauatai, to many lands you've spread,"
"A Watcher sailed to Hasongo, seeking answers and revenge,"
"Volcanoes gushed and islands shook along that perilous chain,"
"The slavers fled - cowards all! - from Crookspur's battered shores."
"Slavers prowled the cays and reefs, seizing Huana souls!"
"The pirate king Furrante was beaten at long last,"
"The pirate queen called Aeldys was beaten at long last,"
"The Huana queen was slain upon the roof of her fair palace,"
"The Huana prince was slain within the fair Kahanga palace,"
"At last united 'neath the banner of glorious Rauatai,"
"Till our fine ships bore us south to Deadfire once again."
"Storms shall never bend your backs, nor battles break your swords."
"What hazard visited Hasongo, what disaster darkened its halls?"
"Heed the call of the ranga nui; his voice shall fill your sails."
"Brave trenchers call for justice; Kahanga fold their hands."
"The Vailians cheered Hasongo's disquiet from afar,"
"Malice lay behind their eyes, their hearts hid treachery."
"He chased the villains from our halls, sent nāga to their dens."
Entries.female: "She chased the villains from our halls, sent nāga to their dens."

Entries.default: "Soon the tales reached our ears of Eothas' wrath reborn,"
"Striding through the sea and surf and striking down his foes."
"Who could stand against a god, what ship survive his rage?"
"A Watcher rose, brave and true, and came to speak for all."
"Rauatai alone was bold, its cannons primed and aimed."
"The goddess Magran boiled and raged, her warning clear to all."
"A ship returned from Magran's Teeth, where none had dared to sail -"
"[Player Name] had spoken to the gods and lived to tell the tale."
"Vailians quivered, Huana trembled, the pirates sighed and wept."
"One stood bold - the hazanui! She raised the banner for all."
"The Watcher sent them from the isle, never to return."
"The Ruquapa sent them from the isle, never to return."
"Who would come with sword and gun to end their evil scourge?"
"His corsair brethren turned from him with greedy, fickle hearts."
"Her corsair brethren turned from her with greedy, fickle hearts."
"The Watcher came with purpose firm to end her feeble rule."
"The Watcher came with purpose firm to end their feeble rule."
"All of Deadfire came together to meet the coming dawn."
"A ship that sailed beneath the waves from Sayuka came,"
"To speed the bold of Rauatai toward Ukaizo's heart."
"Sayuka's coral grew until the Watcher ventured deep,"
"To bind the powers that the old Engwithans nurtured there."
"Sayuka's coral grew and grew, and monsters roamed its bog."
"The Watcher dove beneath the waves and bargained with a god."
